title: Olaf E hitbox
body:
Its seems to me that his E has to be like, definitely within the line of the range of the ability.

I feel this is bullshit, on account of the fact that so many other champions get to have their ability hit if its on the line or even, slightly outside of it, like Sion. 

Feels like hes getting the short end of the stick compared to other champions hit boxes

replies.body: Olaf e is a point and click true damage slam. Are you talking about his q because I feel it is pretty accurate, maybe just a little short of the animation

>
> Olaf e is a point and click true damage slam. Are you talking about his q because I feel it is pretty accurate, maybe just a little short of the animation

No, his E. Whether or not its strong or too good even is besides the point. Hitboxes should be consitent

But it’s point and click, the animation is him slamming his axes into you. There isn’t a hit box for a point and click single target spell.

Buty there is a range indicator and if you try to use it to understand how far you can be away from the target to cast his E, you will be mislead

> No, his E. Whether or not its strong or too good even is besides the point. Hitboxes should be consitent

If you're sure you're talking about his E, can you explain what you mean by a consistent hitbox on a point-and-click targeted ability?

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=zUMbAdJH,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2019-05-14T22:41:51.775+0000)
>
> If you're sure you're talking about his E, can you explain what you mean by a consistent hitbox on a point-and-click targeted ability?

When you hover over the ability it shows the range. A circle that shows the range of the ability. When you actually try to use it, it seem like a much shorter range than indicated by the lines
If you play a champ with a big hitbox its like a panth q with more damage and a slow.
